page.title: 14Hounds at Melchbourne
page.content: The Oakley Hunt employs two Kennelmen who are responsible for 39.5 couples that is 69 hounds. 17 couples are dogs and the restare bitches. The hounds are kept in 4 lodges,18 couples in each.The sleeping quarters are filled with straw, which is changed every other day and the runs are scrubbed out 3 times a day. The hounds are fed once a day on a diet of faw meat and have water to drink. Durins the summer they are exercised from bycycles for 2.5 hours each day, then from horses for 3 hours in August. In the hunting season they are walked out on non-hunting days. Basic vetinary care is attended to by the kennelmen. The kennelmen also provide a knackering service for a large area. This meat is used to feed the hounds.
